bibl.idno: The Papers of Henry Rose Carter [manuscript] ; HEALTHSCI MS-10.

bibl.title: Letter from J. W. W. Stephens to Laura Armistead Carter, [November 26, 1928]

div1.p: Stephens is having difficulty tracking down some references for Carter, but is still trying to get an answer for her.

div1.head: Letter from J. W. W. Stephens to Laura Armistead Carter, [November 26, 1928]
div1.opener:
Book. Bibliography,
Stevens, J. W. W.
Copy. (Envelope dated Nov. 26, 1928.
4 Somers Place,
London W. 2.
Dear Miss Carter:
div1.p:
I am sorry to have delayed so in replying to your letter and all
the more so because my enquiries have resulted in an absolute blank.
Have been to various people in London, but all with no result. I have
resigned my post at Liverpool so am not now in the currect of “events”
as I used to be. However I am sending on your papers to Liverpool in
a last despairing hope. Practically I think the importance of the
records of such is exaggerated for quite possibly they were
casually made and so far as I know have not been confirmed. But I
hope L'pool may be still able to help.
div1.closer:
With kind regards,
Yours sincerely, (Signed) J. W. W. Stevens. Carbon of list incomplete refs. sent to Dr. Stevens hereto attached.
answered - by hand, Dec 11/28
L.A.C.
